reviewText: When I was a kid in the 1950s this movie was on TV at least two times a year and I and my family watched it every time it came on. It's an endearing story of a time that no longer exists, when young ladies of middle school age actually shopped in the "Junior Miss" Dept.  Nowadays, many of the clothes in the "Juniors" dept. look as grown up and sexy as anything you find in "Misses". This is a story of family, friendship, coming of age that will stay with you for a long time. There is much humor, a little romance and some funny misunderstandings. It has never been released even on VHS, but now that it is finally released it's on DVD. Hooray!
summary: Great movie of a bygone era.

reviewText: Excellent...Classic Movie!!!Wholesome entertainment...Great to see a couple of young girls not covered with tattoos or body piercings!!!Remember "Stella Dallas!"Love the part:It was exactly at the stroke of midnight on the 21st. of September that I was born.It was a wild, stormy night and our family doctor fought his way through the terrible rain to reach the bedside of my mother who harbored between life and death.I was a strong, fat, healthy baby and from the very start rejected being called the image of anyone in our family; because I knew I was different….

reviewText: Peggy Ann Garner does a great job portraying a coming-of-age girl during difficult times.  Fun story of assumptions, misunderstandings, sibling rivalry, best friends, first date, and sometimes overly protective parents.Well acted and directed.Worth watching if only for the elevator nonsense -- from the days before automatic elevators -- yes, there used to be a human operator in elevators.  That's where the fun in this film begins.
Title: N/A

reviewText: If you're a fan of 1940's comedies or Christmas films then "Junior Miss" should be added to your "watch list" this holiday season. "Junior Miss" is one of those films that has been missing from television for years--I think AMC, back when they were still a classic movie station was the last to show it in the late 90's--and that's a shame. It's not only a great holiday movie that takes place over the Christmas/New Years season, it's also very funny. The main character is 13 year-old Judy Graves, a "sophisticated" NYC teen who with her best friend Fuffy (Barbara Whiting)inadvertently creates havoc with her well-intentioned good deeds. Judy is played by child actor Peggy Ann Gardner ("A Tree Grows in Brooklyn")and is supported by a great cast that includes Allyn Joslyn and Sylvia Field(who later played Mrs. Wilson on the Dennis the Menace TV show) as her long, suffering parents, Mona Freeman as her older sister, "charming Lois" and John Alexander as dad's blustery boss. Also, look for a young Mel Torme in a small role as one of Lois' dates. The dialogue crackles with funny one-liners and pop culture references to other movies of the time. It's fast-paced, snappy and totally entertaining. I've waited a long time for this film to be released on DVD and I hope others will now discover it and enjoy it's charm, humor and idealized portrayal of 1940's teen-life in the big city.
summary: A little known Christmas film that is a real gem.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I just received this DVD and may I say the quality is great! I was hoping that it would be clear and crisp, and sure enough it is! A no-frills DVD, but that is fine as I am just happy to have the movie in any form...The story is hilarious and Peggy Ann Garner (one of my favorites) is just adorable as the title character. The supporting cast which includes Mona Freeman, Allyn Joslyn, Scotty Beckett, and a very young Mel Torme in a quick scene, but you will laugh just the same. Judy's best friend Fuffy Adams has a striking resemblance to Rosie O'Donnell,and a personality to match! If you have never seen this film, please don't hesitate! You will never be sorry! A laugh a minute!
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is a nice family movie.  It is entertaining.  Two teenage girls that annoy the elevator operator in their apartment building by constantly pushing the button, leaving their roller skates in the lobby, etc., etc.  It gets even funnier when the uncle comes to visit and the younger niece thinks he has been in a prison.  She plays matchmaker between her father's boss' daughter and her uncle.  I love the line "slap happy New Year".  It is one great movie.
summary: They Don't Make Movies Like This Anymore
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is a fun movie.  It is one of my most favorite Christmas movies to watch and I never get tired of it.  Peggy Ann Garner is superb as the main character, Judy. It's a wonderful representation of how life used to be growing up during a very conservative and very simpler time in America.  There are not only funny moments but heartwarming ones too.  You'll enjoy it.
